title: Z390
author: Z390
created_time: October 08, 2022, 09:05:46 AMLast edit: October 08, 2022, 11:44:06 AM by Z390
content: Zilliqa unveiled its web3 gaming console, they said they are ready to compete with PlayStation and Xbox, what do you think about this? The console will have numerous potentials like they claimed which will allow the players to enjoy gaming while mining the network native token, they also announced their first game called Web3 War which is a first-person shooter. https://blockster.com/zilliqa-blockchain-set-to-launch-worlds-first-web3-games-console/

comments.author: Minecache
comments.body: Quote from: Z390 on October 08, 2022, 09:05:46 AMZilliqa unveiled its web3 gaming console, they said they are ready to compete with PlayStation and Xbox, what do you think about this? The console will have numerous potentials like they claimed which will allow the players to enjoy gaming while mining the network native token, they also announced their first game called Web3 War which is a first-person shooter. Can you include a link that contains this specific information? sounds pretty intriguing to me. Although the P2E trend is disappointing because it cannot create games that are as entertaining as traditional games and in the end it couldn't keep its weak appeal. But I still believe that P2E gaming will continue to thrive in the future and it will come back with a completely different look. If this news comes to fruition, it will indeed be a huge step forward for the blockchain gaming industry and could directly threaten traditional gaming companies.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: I like what the article said that the console could be a good entry point for gamers that are still new to crypto. They're willing to splash money on games they love to play so the prospect of earning something in return could be appealing to them. I hope Zilliqa don't disappoint.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: This is great news for the crypto atmosphere as a whole, Ziliqa is breaking new ground in the gaming world for crypto. There are tons of crypto start-ups making promises about consoles and taking things to the next level, but so far they haven't done anything. With this news, it is possible that crypto competition in the gaming realm will increase, the news also mentions that this console will launch in the first quarter of next year, hopefully Ziliqa will not disappoint us all.

comments.author: mu_enrico
comments.body: They should be focusing on software, something that they are capable to do, coding, and stuff. The console industry is an entirely different space since the big players either (1) have the capability to design good quality hardware, or (2) have the content delivery experience (or both). These are two KSFs in the console. You don't just publish a few games proprietary for a specific console. No one will buy the console. That said, the PC ecosystem is still better since gamers don't have to purchase new hardware, in other words, lower entry barrier and easier adoption.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Why would they prioritize releasing hardware over developing the so-called "skill-to-earn" games instead? And I don't think people will buy a console for a small number of unknown games, regardless of how popular (in the past) p2e games were, or s2e in their model. They still have that issue of balancing the entire economy centered around the games they're going to make which is insanely difficult imo since there's a bunch of factors involved, not to mention involving the enjoyment factor in it (since in the end, games are for entertainment regardless if you can earn or not).
